item.description:
Failte!

Welcome to the next Thirsty First Thursdays - this one north of the river - at "The Burren" in Davis Square, Somerville.

"The Burren" is a great Irish pub with a good selection of beers, good pub food (I recommend the Shepherd's Pie) and some real live Irish music in the corner (fiddles, accordian, bohdran, guitar & flute) to tap your foot / nod your head to.

The name means 'Great Rock' in Irish, if you're interested, there's more at:
http://en.wikipedia.o...

Easiest way to get there is to take the red line T to Davis and come up onto Holland St. side.
Once on street level - turn right and walk into square. Go two blocks down Elm St. and it's on the left side. Call me on my cell (978-289-2364) if you get lost.

I'll be wearing a green & blue Guinness rugby shirt and drinking Smithwicks.
(Note: They always card, so please remember your Mass ID or passport.)

So, come for food, beer and the 'craic'!
Cheers, Steve O.
item.how_to_find_us: In agreen & blue Guinness rugby shirt, drinking Smithwick's (cell 978-289-2364)

group.name: The Boston Expat Aussie Meetup Group

item.name: Thirsty First Thursday #4: The Burren (Davis Square)
